h3. Steps to reproduce:

Upgrade Confluence to 5.5.X

fields.description:
Line deletion of coloured text seems to inherit the second line's colour formatting.

Steps to reproduce:
# create new page
# create three lines of words with different colour
# put the cursor on the left side of the line
# hold shift and press down arrow on keyboard
# backspace to delete the text

Current result: the second line coloured text inherits the coloured text of the third line

Expected result: the second line coloured text should not inherits the coloured text of the third line

Attached is the descriptive screenshot of the bug in Firefox by one of our customer
fields.summary: Firefox inherits formatting of the line below after first line deletion when holding Shift+down arrow
Shared Links Blueprint - Group by Topic (as Headings)

fields.description:
when you are in your blog or at your "pages"-site your keyboard shortcuts won't work anymore.

You can't even click to display them (on your standalone you get linked to your dashboard).

We want your "b" for fast creation of a blogpost to work. Is there a way to enable shortcuts for those sites?


When in the blog, clicking on keyboard-shortcuts works on the second try, first there is the following error-message in js:

Uncaught TypeError: undefined is not a function batch.js:6794
Confluence.KeyboardShortcuts.getDialog batch.js:6794
Confluence.KeyboardShortcuts.openDialog batch.js:6585
d.event.dispatch batch.js:73
g.handle.i

Any suggestions?
fields.summary: Keyboard-shortcut problem

fields.description:
*How to Replicate The Bug*

# Create a test page
# Assigned a task to a user
# User will receive "Assigned Task" notification
# Re-order the page in the same space
# User will receive *another* "Assigned Task" notification for the previously assigned task

*Expected Behaviour*

Confluence should not trigger a *new* assigned task notification as the task is not newly assigned to the user.

*Extra Notes*

Moving the page to another space won't trigger a new notification.
fields.summary: Moving Page Trigger Task Notification for Old Tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34060].
  {panel}

this page-property macro is ordered by the _Prio_ column.
!24-06-2014 22-10-39.png!

the result is a sorted list, but the order is not very clear.

users would expect the macro to be sorted according to the text which has been entered in the macro body, in the example
* high
* low
* unknown

however, the orderind that is happening results in
* low
* unknown
* high
--> i suspect its sorted based on the first argument, which seems to be the color
* green (low)
* grey (unknown)
* red (high)

this would be a very nice improvement
fields.summary: Improve status macro for a more intuitive and natural sorting order

fields.description:
If you add an attachment in Confluence and this file contains a ampersand in it's name it will fail to open.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Add two attachments in a Confluence Page.
#* v&p.xlsx
#* v and p.xlsx
# Click in Tools > Attachments.
# Click on Edit in office for "v and p.xlsx"
# The file will open accordingly.
# Now try the same with "v&p.xlsx".
!opening.PNG|thumbnail!
# Once you Click "Ok" you will get the following:
!Error.PNG|thumbnail!
!Error2.PNG|thumbnail!

h4. Work Around:

Rename the attachment and use [Source Editor Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor] so you can find the "&amp" and  replace it for and or a blank space so the markups can get properly updated.
(!) Make a copy of the page for recovery purpose.

h4. Additional notes:
You will see below error reflecting into the logs:
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34055].
  {panel}

After changing the Title column heading to a different name in 'Page properties report' Macro. 
User cannot sort using the different name that he/she have changed. User has to enter "title" to sort. This will confused the user as they do not know they have to use "title" to sort even after they have changed the title name.

Below are the steps to reproduce this:
1. Login to Confluence
2. Go to a Space page
3. Create a new page within the Space
4. In the editor, choose Insert > Other Macros > Page Properties
5. In the macro body create a two column table and remove the header row.
6. In the left column list your 'keys' - these will be the column headings in your report table.
7. In the right column list the value for each key - these will populate the rows in your report table.
8. Add a label to your page - you will need to specify this label in the page properties report macro.
9.Save your page. 

Do this process for a few subsequent new pages.

After that, go to a existing page and choose Insert > Other Macros > Page Properties Report

Input the string "Name" into "Title column heading".

Input "Name" in "Sort by""

Current result : It does not sort after Title have been changed to Name. 
Expected result : It should sort after Title have been changed to Name.
fields.summary: "Page properties report" macro can only be sort using "title"
Add flexible sort on the page list output when clicking the label link

Environment was a cluster setup upgraded from 5.2 while upgrading to issue/CONFDEV-25498 but this issue has been in production for over a year now.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34042].
  {panel}

h3. The problem
While editing a page you have the option to not send notifications, this can be done by unmarking the option "_Notify Watchers_"
!notify_watchers.png!

However this sentence may cause confusion as no one will receive notifications, not only the watchers. For example, if you mention someone that is not watching the page, this person won't receive notification either.

h3. Suggestion
We should change the text "_Notify Watcher_" to just "_Send Notifications_", or some other text that helps to explain that no notifications will be sent at all.
fields.summary: Change the text Notify Watcher

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34028].
  {panel}

h5.Steps to Reproduce:

# Create an expand block
# Inside the expansion block, create a code block, and set {{collapsible=true}}
# Save the page
# Click the expansion link to show the codeblock in it's collapsed state
# Click the codeblock's expansion link

The storage format for the example is as follows:

{code}
<ac:structured-macro ac:name="expand">
  <ac:rich-text-body>
    <ac:structured-macro ac:name="code">
      <ac:parameter ac:name="linenumbers">true</ac:parameter>
      <ac:parameter ac:name="collapse">true</ac:parameter>
      <ac:plain-text-body>
        <![CDATA[#style { font-weight: bold; }]]>
      </ac:plain-text-body>
    </ac:structured-macro>
  </ac:rich-text-body>
</ac:structured-macro>
{code}

h5.Expected Results
The code block should expand and be visible.

h5.Actual Result
The code block expands, and disappears as the outer expand is (incorrectly) collapsed.

h5.Workaround
Expand the outer expand macro again, to reveal the expanded codeblock.

h5.Notes
The reverse is well - collapse the code block, and the outer expand will collapse as well.
fields.summary: Collapsible code macro inside expand block doesn't work as expected

When summing up the milliseconds the page took to load, the result will not be even close to the total it shows at the beginning (29160ms).

This specific page was taking that long to load due to a bug on the Jira Issue Macro, however the profiling log does not mention this macro and not even a request to JIRA.

*Request:*
We know that the profiling is not showing the Jira Issue Macro, so it might not be showing other macros either.

Would be great to have this kind of information on the log, so it would be easier to know what is happening.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Configure your Confluence to use Application Links with your JIRA.
# Enable the Performance Profiling under *Confluence Admin > Logging and Profiling > Performance Profiling*. 
# Create a page in Confluence and add the Jira Issues macro.
# Create a filter to get some issues from your JIRA showing in the macro.
# Save the page and access it afterwards.
# Check the profiling logs.

Note that there's nothing related to the JIRA Issues macro in the profiling logs.
fields.summary: Missing information on Profiling Log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34022].
  {panel}

Currently edit restriction is inherited. Which means that if a parent page have edit permission. All child page will follow as well.

It would be great if the admin can restrict a user to only able to edit a single page in a particular Space and not let the user to be able to edit other pages in the same Space.

For example,
An administrator would like a particular user to only be able to edit 1 page in that particular space but able to view all pages in the Space. I hope this make sense.
fields.summary: Unable to give the right to edit a single page for a single user

When editing a page and accidentally pressing Ctrl-shift-A (to request the macro insert window) multiple times -> locks a user in the macro window.

What happens after pressing multiple Ctrs-shift-A: 
The macro selection window appears, one can select the desired macro, and you can see it being inserted.
However the macro selection window remains present and one can not return to editing the confluence page.
Using the "cancel" link on the macro selection window does not work.
One needs to close the browser window and re-navigate to the page one wants to edit.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34016].
  {panel}

h5.Summary
When working with Custom Fields displayed the JIRA issues macro, Confluence will ignore the case of the fields as they're input into Confluence.

h5.Steps to Reproduce
# In JIRA, create a custom field, and call it "RN Summary"
# In Confluence, create a page, and insert the JIRA Issues Macro
# Under "Display Options" select "Table"
# Under "Display Options" add the Custom Field to the "Columns to Display" section
# Save the page, and view the table

h5.Expected Result
The column header is shown matching the case in JIRA - in this case, "RN Summary"

h5.Actual Result
The column header is displayed using capitalisation. Inspecting the header column reveals the following inline style applied to all of the header columns in the table:

{code}
style="text-align: left; text-transform: capitalize;"
{code}

Additionally, the text inside the header column is lower case.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro should respect the case of custom JIRA Fields

fields.description:
As documented at http://blog.detectify.com/post/86298380233/the-pitfalls-of-allowing-file-uploads-on-your-website it is possible to upload a flash file to confluence with a different content-type than for flash and when embedded on an attacker's domain will be able to make requests to the confluence instance upon which the flash file is hosted. This bug can be used to steal a user's XSRF/CSRF token.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Set up Confluence instance
# Rename a flash file (.swf) to have any image extension (e.g. .png)
# Upload the renamed file to Confluence as attachment and ensure that it has an image content type (e.g. image/png)
# Open http://0me.me/demo/SOP/CrossDomainDataHijackHelper.html
# Enter direct url to the attachment in the "Flash File" field
# Enter base url in the "Target Page" field
# Click "RUN" button

Current behaviour: Flash file is rendered
Expected behaviour: Flash file should not be rendered
fields.summary: Flash content-type sniffing allows Cross Site Data Hijacking

fields.description:
Here is how to reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new Product requirement using the blueprint, on a Space where no product requirement have been created (The Product requirement shortcut does not exists yet)
2. When you save your product requirement, an index page will be created and will also appear as a "Product requirements" shortcut in the navigation panel.
3. Go to the index page that was just created (Product requirements shortcut) and the on top of this page, create a second page by clicking the "Add product requirements" button. Enter a title and save this second requirement.
4. Now, if you look at what you have in the navigation panel, you will see that any product requirement created from the index page will be created as a child of the index page, but the first product requirement created in the Space will not be a child of the index page. (See screenshot attached).

Each time, we need to reorder the first product requirement to be a child of the index page, and this is something which is confusing to explain to people who are new with product requirements in the team.

I think that, by default, once the index is created, this first product requirement should be set as a child page.
fields.summary: First Product Requirement created on a Space is not a child page of the index

fields.description:
With this content: 
{code}
h1. Major Heading 1
h2. Subhead 1
h2. Subhead 2
h1. Major Heading 2
h2. Subhead 1
h2. Subhead 2
{code}
You get this type of HTML: 
{code}
<h1 id="PageNameHere-MajorHeading1">
<h2 id="PageNameHere-Subhead1">
<h2 id="PageNameHere-Subhead2">
<h1 id="PageNameHere-MajorHeading2">
<h2 id="PageNameHere-Subhead1">
<h2 id="PageNameHere-Subhead2">
{code}
I think you see the problem.  None of the h2 ids are unique, so the toc macro produces links for subheadings under Major Heading 2,3,4,etc,  that all go to the subheadings under Major Heading 1. 

If this is fixed in a much newer version, my apologies - i did try to search for it first. 

I realize the workaround (some might say fix) is to ensure all headings are uniquely named.  But I think it's a fairly common usecase to have consistent subheading names, and to *not* have to put a number on them, if you don't want to.
fields.summary: heading ids are not unique, making links produced by toc not useful
ToC should be able to order headings alphabetically

fields.description:
During our plugin development we faced the following error.

1.) Our plugin get the uploaded content to be checked before storage. If there might be some configuration not allowing the storage the plugin sends an error back.

2.) If we call on a page > Edit > Insert > Image and drag/drop an image into the dialog Dnd area, the content get checked as expected. BUT: In case of sending an error back (Status Code: 500 with including error message) the following code throws an error:
        
displayErrors: function() {
            messenger.displayErrors();
        },

As far as we can figure it out the called function "displayErrors" does not exists in the messenger object. Therefore the error sent by our plugin will not be shown to the client. 

File Name: insert-image-dialog-attachments.js
Code Path:
confluence-x.x.x-source\confluence-project\confluence-plugins\confluence-editor-plugins\confluence-editor\src\main\resources\js

It would be very helpful to get this checked by you.

Thanks in advance,
Sabine Winkler
fields.summary: Confluence Editor - Insert image dialog calles non-existing messenger function

fields.description:
h4. The problem
On a Confluence instance using an external user directory deleted users can cause the mentions feature to log NPEs, and stop sending notifications.

The root cause is that DefaultFollowManager.getFollowers() is missing a null check. It should be checking that follower is not null, similar to the check in the getFollowing() method.

The following {{NullPointerException}} is thrown on the logs:
{noformat}
2014-06-13 11:12:26,166 ERROR [http-bio-8552-exec-4] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
 -- referer: http:/localhost:8080/confluence/pages/editpage.action?pageId=917517 | url: /confluence/rest/mentions/1/network.json | userName: admin
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.persistence.dao.CachingPersonalInformationDao.getByUser(CachingPersonalInformationDao.java:34)
...
{noformat}

h4. Workaround
Manually deleting the old references from the {{FOLLOW_CONNECTIONS}} table. This can be done with the following SQL statement:
{code:sql}
delete from follow_connections where follower in (select user_key from user_mapping where lower_username not in (select lower_user_name from cwd_user))
{code}
(!) Make sure to create a database backup before any modification.
(i) Confluence will need to be restarted after remove those entries from the database.
fields.summary: Deleted LDAP user can cause NPE when using mentions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33971].
  {panel}

Another step along the path of confluence towards becoming the documentation development environment of choice should be the tightening of control over the application of styles. The present editor provides 9 controlled styles and there is a tool bar that allows users to control the appearance of text in any manner.

I suggest that site and space configuration options include the ability to:

- declare and define the contents of the paragraph styles dropdown
- declare and define the contents of a new font styles dropdown
- declare and define the contents of a table styles dropdown
- force the remove of the ad hoc settings dropdown

When templates and blueprints are employed, the above features would allow site and space managers to fully control the styling of documentation produced using confluence.

The above styles would apply equally to PDF and HTML exports.
fields.summary: Expansion of styles list and control over free styles

Thanks.

Cause

fields.description:
When calling a link to a PDF export directly without an active browser session the request will fail with a 403 HTTP status code (e.g. sending http://confluence/spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action?pageId=1234567 to somebody via eMail). It seems to be caused by Confluence adding a ";jsessionid=..." to all request coming the first time without an active session and flyingpdf interpreting this as filename.

To clarify: This is not caused by permission restrictions for a) I made sure that anonymous has read access and is allowed to export the space and b) it also happens even if giving an administrative account to the URL (e.g. http://confluence/spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action?pageId=1234567&os_name=abc&os_password=abc).

Rewriting ";" to "?" in Apache conf works around the issue, but that's very dirty (probably with side-effects).

Also see related question at https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/212249/pdf-retrieval-issue-via-webrequest-issue-after-upgrade-from-confluence-3-5-17-to-5-1-5
fields.summary: flyingpdf fails the first time it is called without having an active session

Scenario:
When using an attachment (image) that was originally included by another page, if you delete the page that uploaded the image, any other page that is using that image will lose it.
The problem is that there's no message alerting the users that the image from the page you're going to delete is being used by other pages.

It would be great if Confluence at least warned the user, when removing a page, that an image attachment on the page being deleted is referred to by another page.

fields.summary: Confluence not working in IE but the same is working fine in Firefox browser.

fields.description:
Adding Powerpoint Viewfile Macro inside a user macro breaks the page layout.

*Steps to Replicate*
# Create a simple user macro (e.g: _cp-expand_):
{code}
## @noparams
$body
{code}
# Create a new page
# Attach PPT or PPTX file
# Insert _cp-expand_
# Put the Office Powerpoint of the PPTX in Step 3 inside _cp-expand_
# Save the page
fields.summary: Powerpoint Viewfile Macro Cause Broken Page when Placed Inside User Macro Container
